author: lzybkr
body:
If I want to delete multiple files with one invocation, I have to write:

```PowerShell
del file1,file2
```

It's so easy to forget the comma because you don't need it with any other shell.

I think adding this will require adding a new parameter that to accept `ValueFromRemainingArguments`, so the parameters will look a little weird, changing the `Path` parameter would break cases where an array was passed because the array gets converted to string.
title: Remove-Item should support multiple arguments w/o a comma
